subject: Re: Just replaced my 3.7 jar with 3.8
msgSnippet: And here s the link to PMD (should ve put that in the last post, sorry). http://sourceforge.net/projects/pmd/ -Eric ... catch ... 125 ... 24 ... 25 ... 107 ...
messageBody:
And here's the link to PMD (should've put that in the last post,
sorry).

http://sourceforge.net/projects/pmd/

-Eric

--- In junit@y..., "ericheikkila" <ericheikkila@y...> wrote:
> BTW - I recently download PMD, and it showed me some interesting
> things in our current project. I thought it'd be equally as
> interesting to run it against the JUnit source (since I'm messing
> with the source anyway).
>
> Most of the things it found were lack of curly braces and empty
catch
> blocks, but there were a few other tidbits like:
>
> swingui.TestRunner -unused formal parameter 'kind' -line
125
> swingui.TestRunner -unused private fields 'PLAIN_FONT' -line
24
> swingui.TestRunner -unused private fields 'BOLD_FONT' -line
25
> runner.TextRunnerTest-duplicate import 'java.io.IOException' -line 7
> runner.TextRunnerTest-duplicate import 'junit.framework.TestResult'-

> line 4
> swingui.CounterPanel -unused private method 'asString' -line
107
> framework.Assert -unused formal parameter 'expected' -line
267
> awtui.TestRunner -unused private field 'SUITE_METHODNAME'-line
43
>
>
> -Eric
>
>
> --- In junit@y..., "Berin Loritsch" <bloritsch@a...> wrote:
> > Replace these two classes with what I have, and tell me if it
> > still works.
> >
